title.narrative: Emergency health assistance to mothers, new-borns and children displaced from Tirrah Valley –Khyber Agency from Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) residing in camps and in host communities in KhyberPakhtunkhwa (KP) and FATA

description.narrative: 6. More than 80% of the targeted 1,680 pregnant women receive Tetanus Toxoid (TT) vaccination, & Ante-Natal care 7. More than 70% of 1,680 targeted women undergo least one post natal visit with skilled birth attendants (SBAs) at community level. 8. At least 80% of 14,280 children and 3,360 PLW receive multi-micronutrient supplementation 9. At least 80% of 3,360 PLWs receive health, and hygiene commodities (CDKs, Baby Kits & LLINs) 10. More than 60% of 3,360 PLW receive health and hygiene messages through social mobilizers and facility-based health workers. 11. Relevant IEC Material including Banners and Flyers reporting and recording tools provided to IPs for display and distribution in the communities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

name.narrative: Hangu in KP and in Kurram Agency of FATA, Pakistan
IDP’s in Host communities and Camps of District Kohat &amp, Pakistan
IDP’s in Host communities and Camps of District Kohat & Hangu in KP and in Kurram Agency of FATA, Pakistan

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency health assistance to mothers, new-borns and children displaced from Tirrah Valley –Khyber Agency from Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) residing in camps and in host communities in KhyberPakhtunkhwa (KP) and FATA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
